title: Adjustment of retirement allowances of retirants
context: §88-88 Adjustment of retirement allowances of retirants. The retirement allowance of any class A member whose allowance was reduced by reason of social security coverage subsequent to December 31, 1955, shall be increased by the amount of such reduction; provided that the increase shall be limited to 1&frasl;280 of that part of the class A member&rsquo;s average final compensation not in excess of $4,200 per annum multiplied by the number of years of the class A member&rsquo;s creditable service rendered between January 1, 1956, and January 1, 1965, for which the class A member received compensation covered by social security, and provided that in the case of a member who retired on a service-connected disability retirement the increase shall be limited to 16 and 2&frasl;3 per cent of that part of the member&rsquo;s average final compensation not in excess of $4,200 per year. [L 1969, c 102, §1; gen ch 1985]
